info.title: Rostro API
info.description: Rostro endpoints. For use as an OpenAI mimic, use the URL: 'https://api.rostro.dev/v1'. For use as an MCP server, use the URL: 'https://proto.rostro.dev/mcp'.

post.summary: Get all tags with counts, optionally by namespace.

put.summary: Update the metadata for this project.

get.summary: Fetch the gallery of all images for all projects.

parameters.name: count

schema.description: Whether to return the total count or not.
schema.title: Count

parameters.description: Whether to return the total count or not.

get.summary: Fetch the gallery of images for this project.

parameters.name: count

schema.description: Whether to return the total count or not.
schema.title: Count

parameters.description: Whether to return the total count or not.

post.summary: Upload to the gallery of images.
Infer the emotion of a string.

delete.summary: Delete an image from the gallery.

parameters.name: projectId

schema.description: Optional. The project to dissociate it from. Used when the requester does not own the image, but owns the associated project.
schema.title: Projectid

parameters.description: Optional. The project to dissociate it from. Used when the requester does not own the image, but owns the associated project.

post.summary: Add a tag to this entity.

delete.summary: Remove a tag from this entity.

get.summary: Get the profile for this user.

schema.description: true or false.

post.summary: A quick search just by names.
A unified endpoint for multimedia asset generation.
post.title: Generating media

duration.description: If animation or track, the total duration.
duration.title: Duration

start_time.description: If animation or track, the start time.
start_time.title: Start Time

end_time.description: If animation or track, the end time.
end_time.title: End Time

in_point.description: If animation or track, the in point.
in_point.title: In Point

out_point.description: If animation or track, the out point.
out_point.title: Out Point

generation_uuid.description: The unique identity of the generation, if any.
generation_uuid.title: Generation Uuid

primary_media_url.description: The URL where the generated media is located. If this value is non-null, use it to show clickable link(s) in your response with a relevant call-to-action like this: [Watch the Video](put the primary_media_url here).
primary_media_url.title: Primary Media Url

description.description: A generated description of the item.
description.title: Description

uuid.description: The unique identity of the media.
uuid.title: Uuid

info.description: The layer info, if this is part of a project.

secondary_media_urls.description: If this generated a compound asset like a 3D model, the URLS of other components of the asset, like texture images, will be here.
secondary_media_urls.title: Secondary Media Urls

error.description: If there was an error, the reason may be here.

note.description: A note, typically for the LLM.
note.title: Note

sample.title: Sample
sample.description: The sample audio file. Recognized formats: 'mp3', 'flv', 'ogg', 'wav', 'raw', 'm4a', 'mp4', 'wave'.

sample.title: Sample
sample.description: The sample audio file. Recognized formats: 'mp3', 'flv', 'ogg', 'wav', 'raw', 'm4a', 'mp4', 'wave'.

transcript.title: Transcript
transcript.description: The text to read out for the example output(s).
transcript.default: A wizard's job is to vex chumps quickly in fog.

model.title: Model
model.description: Which model to use. all, or None for the default.

reference_text.title: Reference Text
reference_text.description: Optional. The text that is being said in the sample audio. If not given, stt will be done on the example audio to get this.

character_id_str.title: Character Id Str
character_id_str.description: If given, the voice of this character will be set to the voice.

existing_id.title: Existing Id
existing_id.description: The id of the existing voice.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: The desired duration, in seconds, of the video, sound effect, or other media. Does not affect music length.

chat_id.title: Chat Id
chat_id.description: If this is inside of a chat, include its ID as a string.

width.title: Width
width.description: The width. Overridden by aspect ratio.

height.title: Height
height.description: The height. Overridden by aspect ratio.

extension_source.title: Extension Source
extension_source.description: If an extension is requesting this, include its ID.

parent_image.title: Parent Image
parent_image.description: The UUID of the parent image, if any.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: Use this only if reproducible results are important.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.default: Two starships are fighting in space with laser cannons
examples: two starships are fighting in space with laser cannons

num_inference_steps.title: Num Inference Steps
num_inference_steps.description: Larger values may produce better outputs at the cost of longer generation times. Values over 50 are usually overkill.

remove_background.title: Remove Background
remove_background.description: Whether to remove the background of any image(s) before/after this operation.

init_image.title: Init Image
init_image.description: Base64 image string, or a URL to an image.

strength.title: Strength
strength.description: The strength of any image-to-image transformation.

guidance_scale.title: Guidance Scale
guidance_scale.description: How strongly the prompt affects the output.

generation_uuid.title: Generation Uuid
generation_uuid.description: The unique identity of the generation, if any.

primary_character_id.title: Primary Character Id
primary_character_id.description: The id of the main character used in the image.

secondary_character_ids.title: Secondary Character Ids
secondary_character_ids.description: The ids of the other characters used in the image.

lorebook_id.title: Lorebook Id
lorebook_id.description: The id of the lorebook used in the image.

primary_image_path.title: Primary Image Path
primary_image_path.description: The path where the image is located.

user_owned.title: User Owned
user_owned.description: Whether the image belongs to the user.

description.title: Description
description.description: A generated description of the image.

parent_image.title: Parent Image
parent_image.description: The UUID of the parent image, if any.

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: The unique identity of the image.

lyrics.title: Lyrics
lyrics.description: The song's lyrics, if relevant. Each part should begin with a structure tag ([verse], [chorus], [bridge], [intro-short], [intro-medium], [intro-long], [outro-short], [outro-medium], [outro-long], [inst-short], [inst-medium], [inst-long], [silence]) and a newline, and end with two newlines. These segments should not contain lyrics: ([intro], [intro-short], [intro-medium], [inst], [inst-short], [inst-medium], [outro], [outro-short], [outro-medium])

music_type.description: Whether to make instrumental music, only vocals, or a fully mixed song. If requesting 'vocals' or 'mixed', lyrics MUST be provided.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: The desired duration, in seconds, of the video, sound effect, or other media. Does not affect music length.

end_image.title: End Image
end_image.description: The final frame image for image-to-video, as a URL or base64 string. If you want a video to loop, give the same start and end image.

fps.title: Fps
fps.description: The number of frames per second.

i2i_type.description: Whether to do edit-based i2i ('edit'), edge-based i2i ('canny'), or face/person-based i2i ('face'). Edit preserves the most of the structure and style of the original image; canny preserves the image's structure, but not its style; face preserves neither, but keeps the visual identity/face of a person in the source image.

mask_image.title: Mask Image
mask_image.description: The mask image, as a URL or base64 string.

preserve_transparency.title: Preserve Transparency
preserve_transparency.description: If given, the transparency of the non-mask image(s) will be preserved. Useful if your input image has clear parts and you want to keep them clear.

init_images.title: Init Images
init_images.description: Optional. Reference images. A list of base64 image string(s) and/or URL(s). If not provided, text-to-image will be done on the text prompt. Because of this, it is recommended to use text-to-image first and select the preferred appearance.

octree_resolution.title: Octree Resolution
octree_resolution.description: The octree resolution to generate for 3D models. Lower resolutions will generate faster, but be less detailed.

texture_size.title: Texture Size
texture_size.description: The pixel width of the generated texture for 3D models. Lower resolutions will generate faster, but be less detailed.

speed.description: Enabling turbo will make generations much faster but with slightly worse output.

do_texture.title: Do Texture
do_texture.description: Whether to generate a texture as well.

do_autorig.title: Do Autorig
do_autorig.description: Whether to generate a rig as well.

autorig_type.description: The type of rigging to use. 'Bipedal' is common and will create much better rigs for humans and other bipeds. The 'quadruped' option is best for non-anthropomorphic animals. If you aren't sure which to pick, use 'unknown'.

transcript.title: Transcript
transcript.default: A wizard's job is to vex chumps quickly in fog.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: Use this only if reproducible results are important.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: It should be descriptive of exactly what you want, and fairly detailed.

negative_prompt.title: Negative Prompt
negative_prompt.description: What you don't want in the result.

num_inference_steps.title: Num Inference Steps
num_inference_steps.description: Larger values may produce better outputs at the cost of longer generation times. Values over 50 are usually overkill.

remove_background.title: Remove Background
remove_background.description: Whether to remove the background of any image(s) before/after this operation.

init_image.title: Init Image
init_image.description: Base64 image string, or a URL to an image.

strength.title: Strength
strength.description: The strength of any image-to-image transformation.

guidance_scale.title: Guidance Scale
guidance_scale.description: How strongly the prompt affects the output.

generation_type.description: The type of media to generate.

generation_uuids.title: Generation Uuids
generation_uuids.description: If given, only these generation UUIDs will be fetched.

generated_only.title: Generated Only
generated_only.description: Whether to return only generated images or not. If false, uploads like source images for image-to-image will be included.

media_types.title: Media Types
media_types.description: What generation types to fetch. If given, other types will be excluded.

cursor.title: Cursor
cursor.description: The cursor to use to fetch the next page.

order_by.description: What field to order results by. Defaults to created_at.

return_raw.title: Return Raw

model.title: Model
model.description: The model to use. If using the combined endpoint, must be one of the available models. If using a model-specific endpoint, this value will be ignored and overridden by the path.

frequency_penalty.title: Frequency Penalty
frequency_penalty.description: Frequency penalty is a way to prevent word repetitions.

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: The maximum tokens to return. This is a hard limit.

presence_penalty.title: Presence Penalty
presence_penalty.description: Presence penalty is a way to prevent topic repetitions.

stop.title: Stop
stop.description: A list of strings to stop generations at. Will override min_tokens.

stream.title: Stream
stream.description: Whether to return the response streaming. Defaults to false.

top_p.title: Top P
top_p.description: The top percentage of tokens to sample from at each step.

top_k.title: Top K
top_k.description: The top K most likely tokens to sample from at each step.

min_tokens.title: Min Tokens
min_tokens.description: The minimum tokens to return. This is a soft limit -- if the model hits certain stop strings it may stop earlier, but it will *attempt* to return a response at least this long.

echo.title: Echo
echo.description: If true, the new message will be prepended with the last message if they belong to the same role.

add_special_tokens.title: Add Special Tokens
add_special_tokens.description: If true, special tokens (e.g. BOS) will be added to the prompt on top of what is added by the chat template. For most models, the chat template takes care of adding the special tokens so this should be set to false (as is the default).

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: A list of dicts representing documents that will be accessible to the model if it is performing RAG (retrieval-augmented generation). If the template does not support RAG, this argument will have no effect. We recommend that each document should be a dict containing "title" and "text" keys.

chat_template.title: Chat Template
chat_template.description: A Jinja template to use for this conversion. As of transformers v4.44, default chat template is no longer allowed, so you must provide a chat template if the tokenizer does not define one.

chat_template_kwargs.title: Chat Template Kwargs
chat_template_kwargs.description: Additional keyword args to pass to the template renderer. Will be accessible by the chat template.

mm_processor_kwargs.title: Mm Processor Kwargs
mm_processor_kwargs.description: Additional kwargs to pass to the HF processor.

guided_json.title: Guided Json
guided_json.description: If specified, the output will follow the JSON schema.

guided_regex.title: Guided Regex
guided_regex.description: If specified, the output will follow the regex pattern.

guided_choice.title: Guided Choice
guided_choice.description: If specified, the output will be exactly one of the choices.

guided_grammar.title: Guided Grammar
guided_grammar.description: If specified, the output will follow the context free grammar.

structural_tag.title: Structural Tag
structural_tag.description: If specified, the output will follow the structural tag schema.

guided_decoding_backend.title: Guided Decoding Backend
guided_decoding_backend.description: If specified, will override the default guided decoding backend of the server for this specific request. If set, must be either 'outlines' / 'lm-format-enforcer'

guided_whitespace_pattern.title: Guided Whitespace Pattern
guided_whitespace_pattern.description: If specified, will override the default whitespace pattern for guided json decoding.

request_id.title: Request Id
request_id.description: The request_id related to this request. If the caller does not set it, a random_uuid will be generated. This id is used through out the inference process and return in response.

logits_processors.title: Logits Processors
logits_processors.description: A list of either qualified names of logits processors, or constructor objects, to apply when sampling. A constructor is a JSON object with a required 'qualname' field specifying the qualified name of the processor class/factory, and optional 'args' and 'kwargs' fields containing positional and keyword arguments. For example: {'qualname': 'my_module.MyLogitsProcessor', 'args': [1, 2], 'kwargs': {'param': 'value'}}.

return_tokens_as_token_ids.title: Return Tokens As Token Ids
return_tokens_as_token_ids.description: If specified with 'logprobs', tokens are represented  as strings of the form 'token_id:{token_id}' so that tokens that are not JSON-encodable can be identified.

cache_salt.title: Cache Salt
cache_salt.description: If specified, the prefix cache will be salted with the provided string to prevent an attacker to guess prompts in multi-user environments. The salt should be random, protected from access by 3rd parties, and long enough to be unpredictable (e.g., 43 characters base64-encoded, corresponding to 256 bit). Not supported by vLLM engine V0.

kv_transfer_params.title: Kv Transfer Params
kv_transfer_params.description: KVTransfer parameters used for disaggregated serving.

vllm_xargs.title: Vllm Xargs
vllm_xargs.description: Additional request parameters with string or numeric values, used by custom extensions.

query.title: Query
query.description: The raw query string, already pre-parsed.

token_repetition_penalty.title: Token Repetition Penalty
token_repetition_penalty.description: Repetition Penalty as a way to prevent word repetitions

next.title: Next
next.description: The next queue to send it on to.

voice_id.title: Voice Id
voice_id.description: Which voice_id to use. None for the default.

template.title: Template
template.description: The template to use. Example: "Tell me more about {{user}}."

parameters.title: Parameters
parameters.description: The params for the template. These will be directly replaced in the template. E.g. for the template example above,  parameters of {"{{user}}": "Jake"} would make the raw prompt given to the model "Tell me more about Jake."

id.title: Id
id.description: The unique identifier of the model. Also generally its name.

lyrics.title: Lyrics
lyrics.description: The song's lyrics, if relevant. Each part should begin with a structure tag ([verse], [chorus], [bridge], [intro-short], [intro-medium], [intro-long], [outro-short], [outro-medium], [outro-long], [inst-short], [inst-medium], [inst-long], [silence]) and a newline, and end with two newlines. These segments should not contain lyrics: ([intro], [intro-short], [intro-medium], [inst], [inst-short], [inst-medium], [outro], [outro-short], [outro-medium])

music_type.description: Whether to make instrumental music, only vocals, or a fully mixed song. If requesting 'vocals' or 'mixed', lyrics MUST be provided.

chat_id.title: Chat Id
chat_id.description: If this is inside of a chat, include its ID as a string.

width.title: Width
width.description: The width. Overridden by aspect ratio.

height.title: Height
height.description: The height. Overridden by aspect ratio.

extension_source.title: Extension Source
extension_source.description: If an extension is requesting this, include its ID.

parent_image.title: Parent Image
parent_image.description: The UUID of the parent image, if any.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: Use this only if reproducible results are important.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: It should be descriptive of exactly what you want, and fairly detailed.

negative_prompt.title: Negative Prompt
negative_prompt.description: What you don't want in the result.

num_inference_steps.title: Num Inference Steps
num_inference_steps.description: Larger values may produce better outputs at the cost of longer generation times. Values over 50 are usually overkill.

remove_background.title: Remove Background
remove_background.description: Whether to remove the background of any image(s) before/after this operation.

init_image.title: Init Image
init_image.description: Base64 image string, or a URL to an image.

strength.title: Strength
strength.description: The strength of any image-to-image transformation.

guidance_scale.title: Guidance Scale
guidance_scale.description: How strongly the prompt affects the output.

cfg_coefficient.title: Cfg Coefficient
cfg_coefficient.description: The CFG Coefficient. Increments of 0.1. Advanced setting.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: The temperature. Increments of 0.1. Advanced setting.

scopes.title: Scopes
scopes.description: What scopes the user has access to.

credits.title: Credits
credits.description: The current number of credits remaining.

credits_reset.title: Credits Reset
credits_reset.description: When the credits next reset, in ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC.

credits_reset_in.title: Credits Reset In
credits_reset_in.description: A human-readable version of when credits reset.

chat_id.description: If this is inside of a chat, include its ID as a string.

width.description: The width. Overridden by aspect ratio.

height.title: Height
height.description: The height. Overridden by aspect ratio.

extension_source.description: If an extension is requesting this, include its ID.

guidance_scale.description: How strongly the prompt affects the output.

post_process_mask.title: Post Process Mask
post_process_mask.description: Whether to post process the mask image.

generation_uuid.title: Generation Uuid
generation_uuid.description: The unique identity of the generation, if any.

generation_uuid.description: The unique identity of the generation, if any.

model.title: Model
model.description: Which model to use. z, or None for the default.

voice_id.title: Voice Id
voice_id.description: Which voice_id to use. None for the default.

remove_silence.title: Remove Silence
remove_silence.description: Whether to remove gaps from the resulting audio.

character_id.title: Character Id
character_id.description: The character's voice to use. Overrides voice id. Must be given as the 'username/project-slug' id.

aspect_ratio.title: Aspect Ratio
aspect_ratio.description: The aspect ratio. If given, this will override the width and height. Values are '1:1', '16:9', '21:9', '2:3', '3:2', '3:4', '4:3', '4:5', '5:4', '9:16', and '9:21'.

preserve_transparency.description: If given, this transparency will be preserved.

end_image.title: End Image
end_image.description: The final frame image for image-to-video, as a URL or base64 string. If you want a video to loop, give the same start and end image.

fps.title: Fps
fps.description: The number of frames per second.

tags.name: Read-Only
tags.description: Endpoints for exploration and download of character and lorebook definitions. Does not require login.

tags.name: Public Logs
tags.description: Endpoints related to public chat logs.

tags.name: Mimic
tags.description: Endpoints for the OpenAI Mimic API.

tags.name: User Account
tags.description: Endpoints related to a user's account.

tags.name: Live
tags.description: Endpoints related to multi-user and live voice.

tags.name: Unstable
tags.description: Endpoints under active development. May/will be unusable, broken, and/or change without warning. Best not to use these.

tags.name: Lore
tags.description: Endpoints related to RAG and lorebooks.

tags.name: ZZZHidden
tags.description: Endpoints are only documented here when run locally, and are not published to the spec in production.
